column5: I've been back to the Nipigon a few more times and the fishing has improved from the drought conditions we had in the spring. The river and lake levels are getting close to normal and the Nipigon water temperature is in the low 50's. Here are a few photos with all fish tagged and released. I took one of the young guys from the fly tying club to catch his first Nipigon Brookie and he outfished me. I guess that's the last time he goes! Alan
You never cease to amaze me, Al. Absolutely gorgeous fish and scenery!  Thanks for sharing.
Thanks for posting, those are some incredible fish and on the fly to boot. Doesn't get any better than that!
Great fish, Congrats and they have to be one of the prettiest fish in the waters. Great photos Thanks.
Great pictures.....thanks for sharing.  May need to use that 2nd one as my wallpaper.....  dk
AMAZING pictures! Looks like a little piece of heaven up there.  Great catches and report!
Wow we don't get to see big healthy trout like those to often.Great report  MTP

So that's what being retired is all about, eh Al?? I just might have to venture up river one of these days. Fantastic photos as always. And.... I'll drop that report off in your mailbox this weekend on my way to the Neebing. Promise. I haven't forgotten about it.

Thanks everyone: Here is one more beauty that went back. Yes, Dan...that's what retirement is all about...fishing...right after I've done the dishes, cut the lawn and cleaned the floors. By the way, "I have a head ache tonight!". I'll look forward to that report. Alan
Another great fish!  Looks like you're trying to teach him how to fish.
